name: Dr John Knottenbelt
title: Medical Director
profile: BSc, MB ChB (Birm), FRCP (Lon), FRCS (Ed), FFAEM
description: John is the Medical Director of Doctor Today. He also works as a consultant in Accident and Emergency. Having qualified in 1968 and having worked in Zimbabwe, South Africa and the UK, he has a wide experience of medical and surgical problems, especially emergencies. His special interests are pain relief, treatment of backache and neck ache, the effects of injuries, side effects of medications and puzzling symptoms.

name: Dr Marissa Vassiliou
title: Lead GP Partner and Practice Manager
description: Dr Vassiliou qualified at the University of Witwatersrand in South Africa in 2003. She has a keen interest in paediatrics and was awarded the prize for 'Excellence In Paediatrics' during her internship year. After this she did a further year of community work looking after families in the South African Military. She has been working as a doctor in the UK since 2006 with experience in general practice, corporate health and A&E. She has been working at Doctor Today since 2007 and is the lead practice partner. She has completed a Diploma in Obstetrics and Gynaecology and is an associate member of the Royal College of GPs. She is married with a two children and is very keen on child health and nutrition.

name: RGN Debbie Joffe
title: Practice Nurse and Operations Director
description: Originally from South Africa, Debbie furthered her nursing career in London at Middlesex University. Debbie is a qualified registered nurse, prescriber and aesthetics practitioner. She is trained and experienced in a variety of nursing skills as well as in wrinkle reduction using Botulinum Toxin A and Dermal Fillers. When she is not with patients she loves to spend time on long walks with her daughter and golden retriever's. Debbie has an excellent reputation as a nurse and is well known for her caring and attentive bedside manner.

name: Shana Monrose
title: Administration Team Leader
description: Shana joined us in September 2017 bringing with her a very strong background in administration. Originally from London, she has a strong interest in beauty, fashion and holistic therapies including massage.

name: Counsellor and Clinical Hypnotherapist
title: Counsellor and Clinical Hypnotherapist
description: Karen Richardson, who also works at Doctor Today, is a qualified counsellor with over 20 years' experience in short and long-term counselling. She does one-to-one counselling and also works with couples. Her areas of expertise include anxiety and depression, anger management, bereavement, addictions and relations. She employs, when appropriate, hypnotherapy and cognitive behavioural therapy. She practises at Doctor Today and in Fulham. Karen also talks to students on the hazards of addictions and compulsions, including eating disorders, self-harming, the gateway drugs of alcohol, cigarettes(including vaping), nitrous oxide and cannabis, binge drinking, gambling and bullying. She gives talks to parents, separately, on those addictions and compulsions, including how to spot the danger signals and promote self-esteem in adolescents.

name: Robin Lansman (Independent Service Provider)
title: Osteopath
description: Robin Lansman qualified at the British School of Osteopathy (now University College of Osteopathy) in 1988. He was Senior Tutor of Sports Injuries at the British School of Osteopathy for 10 years, treating sports injuries at both Recreational and Competitive levels. He opened the first of his Body Back-Up Clinics and worked with GP Surgeries and Sports Clubs as well as private practice.He specialises in back pain and sciatica, arm and shoulder pain (Thoracic Outlet Syndrome) as well as pregnancy care, related joint and muscle pains in the back and pelvis. Robin loves Badminton and other racquet sports, uses the gym and has run The British 10k in Central London. He is a passionate about theatre directing, musical theatre and travel. You can learn more about Robin by visiting the Body Back-up website.
